H0.text: Gravity is increasing as the stuntman jumps off the roof of a building and falls toward an airbag on a movie set.

H1.text: Wind velocity is increasing while a stuntman jumps off the roof of a building on a movie set and falls toward an airbag.

H2.text: Kinetic energy is increasing as the stuntman jumps off the roof of a building and falls toward the airbag.

H3.text: Potential energy is increasing as the stuntman, who has jumped off the roof of a building on a movie set, falls toward the airbag.

A4.text: the kinetic energy of a moving object is equal to the work required to bring it from rest to that speed, or the work the object can do while being brought to rest: net force Ã— displacement = kinetic energy

A5.text: Since the kinetic energy increases with the square of the speed, an object doubling its speed has four times as much kinetic energy
